text:
The trek into Sundance Lodge is really picturesque
You're going over the Sundance Valley, overlooking

Brewster's Creek
And it's only about 10km, I think it's the

closest backcountry lodge to civilization
out here in Banff.

You can get in by fat biking, you can come
snowshoeing, or you can do cross country skiing.

We got the best of both worlds, we went cross
country skiing in and snowshoeing out.

And I think for my skill set, snowshoeing's
the way to go.

But I think for people who are avid cross
country skiiers.

Woa, I think you can do it in about an hour
if you're really keen, hour and a half on
average.
So it's the way to go.
Ready for the Olympics!
We made it!
See you in there!

Depending on the trail you take, Sundance
Lodge is a 10 - 16 km trek from Banff.

It sleeps 30 people and it's powered by solar
power.

The cozy lodge is a great place to get away
from it all with no Internet service to cause
distraction.

Breakfast by an executive chef in the middle
of the Rocky Mountains, you can't beat that.
Thanks Steven!
You're welcome.
Good job man, awesome!
The foods' been awesome.
Thank you.

Well we're out here shooting some stars at
the Sundance Lodge, it turned out to be a
beautiful night.

It's completely clear, not a cloud in the
sky, great way to get some shots of the Milky
Way.
Well, that'll do it.

We had an amazing time at Sundance Lodge here
in Banff.

And I have to say, if you do make it here
and I suggest you do, make sure you get out
to the backcountry
